custom_item_1.description: macOS Compliance Policy - Require system integrity protection
custom_item_1.info: This control determines whether system integrity protection is required.
custom_item_1.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'Device Health' verify that 'Require system integrity protection' is set to 'Require'.

custom_item_2.description: macOS Compliance Policy - Require a password to unlock devices.
custom_item_2.info: This setting specifies whether to require users to enter a password before access is granted to information on their devices.
custom_item_2.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Require a password to unlock devices' is set to 'Require'.
custom_item_2.regex: Require a password to unlock devices:
custom_item_2.expect: Require a password to unlock devices: true

custom_item_3.info: This setting specifies whether to require users to enter a password before access is granted to information on their devices.
custom_item_3.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Require a password to unlock devices' is set to 'Require'.
custom_item_3.regex: Require a password to unlock devices:
custom_item_3.expect: Require a password to unlock devices: true

custom_item_4.description: macOS Compliance Policy - Block Simple Passwords
custom_item_4.info: This control determines whether simple passwords such as 1111 or 1234 are allowed.
custom_item_4.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance policy. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Simple passwords' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_5.description: macOS Compliance Policy - Minimum password length
custom_item_5.info: This control determines whether a minimum length password is required. It is recommended that a passcode of 5 or more be set.
custom_item_5.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Minimum Password Length' is configured correctly.

custom_item_6.description: macOS Compliance Policy - Required password type
custom_item_6.info: This control determines whether alphanumeric passcode is required.
custom_item_6.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Password Type' is set to 'Alphanumeric'.

custom_item_7.description: macOS Compliance Policy - Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password
custom_item_7.info: This control determines whether non-alphanumeric characters in the password is required.
custom_item_7.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password' is set to 1 or more.
custom_item_7.regex: Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password:
custom_item_7.expect: Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password: [1-4]$

custom_item_8.description: macOS Compliance Policy - Maximum minutes of inactivity before password is required
custom_item_8.info: This control determines the amount of idle time before the screen will lock and reentry of the passcode is required.
custom_item_8.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that the 'Maximum minutes of inactivity before password is required' is set to 5 or less.
custom_item_8.regex: Maximum minutes of inactivity before password is required:
custom_item_8.expect: Maximum minutes of inactivity before password is required: [1-5]$

custom_item_9.info: This control determines the maximum age of a password.
custom_item_9.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Password expiration (days)' is set to 90 or less.

custom_item_10.description: macOS Device Management - Number of previous passwords to prevent reuse
custom_item_10.info: This control determines the number of reused passwords that are not allowed.
custom_item_10.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Number of previous passwords to prevent reuse' is set to 5 or more.

custom_item_11.description: macOS Device Management - Encryption of data storage on device
custom_item_11.info: This control determines whether encryption of data storage on device is required.
custom_item_11.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Encryption of data storage on device' is set to 'Require'.
custom_item_11.regex: Encryption of data storage on device:
custom_item_11.expect: Encryption of data storage on device: true

custom_item_12.info: This control determines whether the Firewall is enabled.
custom_item_12.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Firewall' is set to 'Enable'.

custom_item_13.info: Block all incoming connections except those required for basic internet services such as DHCP, Bonjour, and IPSec.
custom_item_13.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Incoming connections' is set to 'Block'.

custom_item_14.info: Enabling stealth mode prevents the computer from responding to probing requests.
custom_item_14.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Stealth Mode' is set to 'Enable'.

custom_item_15.info: This control determines whether a password is required to unlock the device.
custom_item_15.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Password' is set to 'Require'.

custom_item_16.description: macOS Device Management - Required password type
custom_item_16.info: This control determines what type of password must be used.
custom_item_16.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Required password type' is set to 'Alphanumeric'.

custom_item_17.description: macOS Device Management - Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password
custom_item_17.info: This control determines whether non-alphanumeric characters in the password is required.
custom_item_17.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password' is set to 1 or more.
custom_item_17.regex: Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password:
custom_item_17.expect: Number of non-alphanumeric characters in password: [1-4]$

custom_item_18.description: macOS Device Management - Minimum password length
custom_item_18.info: This control determines whether a minimum length password is required. It is recommended that a passcode of 5 or more be set.
custom_item_18.solution: From the Intune console, open the compliance profile. Under 'System Security' verify that 'Minimum Password Length' is configured correctly.

custom_item_19.description: macOS Device Management - Block simple passwords
custom_item_19.info: This control determines whether simple passwords are allowed.
custom_item_19.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Block simple passwords' is set to 'Yes'.

custom_item_20.description: macOS Device Management - Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required
custom_item_20.info: This control determines the grace period a device can be unlocked without a password after screen lock.
custom_item_20.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required' is set to 'Immediately'.
custom_item_20.regex: Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required:
custom_item_20.expect: Maximum minutes after screen lock before password is required: 0$

custom_item_21.description: macOS Device Management - Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks
custom_item_21.info: This control determines the minutes of inactivity until the screen locks.
custom_item_21.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks' is set to 5 or less.
custom_item_21.regex: Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks:
custom_item_21.expect: Maximum minutes of inactivity until screen locks: [1-5]$

custom_item_22.info: This control determines the maximum age of a password.
custom_item_22.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Password expiration (days)' is set to 90 or less.

custom_item_23.description: macOS Device Management - Prevent reuse of previous passwords
custom_item_23.info: This control determines the number of reused passwords that are not allowed.
custom_item_23.solution: From the Intune console, open the device configuration profile. Under 'Password' verify that 'Prevent reuse of previous passwords' is set to 5 or more.
